author: Jacob Panons
title: Romesh Ranganathan calls school placement process change
text:
Comedian Romesh Ranganathan has called for his local council to make its school placement process less stressful for parents.
Mr Ranganathan's appeal to get his youngest son into one of his preferred secondary schools was turned down by West Sussex County Council (WSCC).
The TV presenter said: "Parents are struggling to make ends meet, they've got all sorts of other stresses in their lives, this being more stressful than it needs to, in my opinion, is not acceptable."
WSCC said: "This year we were able to offer 87% of the 9,050 secondary school applicants a place at their first choice of school, while nearly 97% were offered a place at one of their three preferences."
In April, the comedian said he had emailed WSCC six times after his son had been placed in a school "on the other side of town", and not at the same school as his two older brothers.
Since talking about his concerns on social media, Mr Ranganathan said he had received messages from families who had been "messed around" by councils, "particularly" WSCC.
"What became clear from people getting in touch is that the system is letting people down and there's people whose kids have been allocated schools that are so far away they don't know how they're going to do the school run," he added.
The council said it understood the disappointment of parents who were not offered a place at a preferred school but explained that it was sometimes not possible "due to a number of factors relating to the selection criteria".
Getty Images Mr Ranganathan hosts A League of Their Own and a Saturday morning show on BBC Radio 2 WSCC explained: "Applications are considered by our admissions team on their priority according to the relevant oversubscription criteria for their preferred schools, which may include proximity of the school to home and whether other siblings attend the same school."
Mr Ranganathan is calling on the council to look at the level of provision for children going into education.
He says the system "needs to get sorted out".
"We need to feel like the education of our children is something that is being cared about by the people that are in control of these things."
The comedian said trying to get your child into education was "one of the most stressful things".
The comedian says although he understands the system "can't be perfect for everybody", he says it can come across "very faceless and quite cold" for some parents.
He said: "It's one of the most important things you'll ever sort out, but from the other side it doesn't feel like that it's being treated with that level of reverence."
Follow BBC Sussex on Facebook , on X , and on Instagram . Send your story ideas to southeasttoday@bbc.co.uk or WhatsApp us on 08081 002250.
More on this story Romesh Ranganathan loses son's school place appeal Ranganathan criticises council over school places Ranganathan opens up about mental health struggle Related internet links West Sussex County Council

author: hindi.sportskeeda.com
title: "Whatever that was": Mikal Bridges scorches Nets' decision to bench him in Bucks loss
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Mikal Bridges scorches Nets' decision to bench him in Bucks loss Like what you are reading? Unlock the Full Story for Free! Sign in with Google Continue with Facebook Login using other methods Brooklyn Nets wing Mikal Bridges expressed his dissatisfaction with the team's approach to their game against the Milwaukee Bucks on Wednesday, particularly the decision to limit his playing time.
Mikal Bridges played all 12 minutes of the first quarter and did not see action the rest of the game, which Brooklyn lost, 144-122. The game marked the Nets‚Äô second in as many days, securing a 118-112 victory over the Detroit Pistons a day before.
Mikal Bridges openly expressed his discontent with the decision:
‚Ä¢
70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now ‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt like the choice and whatever that was,‚Äù he told The New York Post. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs whatever. Definitely was not a fan.‚Äù Expand Tweet Mikal Bridges played 40 minutes against Detroit and had 21 points. He had six points and three rebounds in limited minutes against Milwaukee.
The Nets also opted to rest starters Spencer Dinwiddie , Nic Claxton and Cameron Johnson and crucial reserve Dorian Finney-Smith in the Milwaukee game. Like Bridges, Cam Thomas ‚Äì the leading scorer for Brooklyn ‚Äì and veteran wing Royce O'Neale did not re-enter the game after the first quarter.
Nets coach Jacque Vaughn explained that the decision to limit playing time and rest key players was made to preserve their health:
"I have too much respect for the dudes that suit up and put their body on the line and the competition level to even mention the word exhibition," Vaughn said. "Any guy could have ended their career tonight by one play, and so I treat it as such." Expand Tweet The Nets, currently standing at a 15-16 record, are scheduled to resume play on Friday with an away game against the Washington Wizards, who hold a 5-25 record.
Mikal Bridges keeps his Iron Man streak alive Mikal Bridges is known for his durability. He has been making headlines for his impressive streak of games played, having not missed a game since his junior year in high school.
Despite playing limited minutes on Wednesday, he was able to keep the streak, which is the longest active streak in the NBA, to 423 games.
During his college days at Villanova , Bridges played all 116 games for the Wildcats.
Even when he was traded in the middle of the previous season, Bridges still participated in all possible games. His total number of games played last season amounted to 83, surpassing the standard 82-game total per team.
Bridges is averaging 21.1 points, 5.3 rebounds and 3.8 assists in 33.9 minutes per game this season.

author: Les Echos
title: Jeux vid√©o : Microsoft supprime 650 postes chez Xbox et Activision | Les Echos
text:
Mauvaise nouvelle chez Microsoft. Le g√©ant de la tech va en effet licencier 650 employ√©s de sa branche de jeux vid√©o. Une nouvelle ¬´ difficile √† entendre ¬ª, a admis jeudi Phil Spencer, le patron des jeux vid√©o du groupe informatique, dans une lettre aux employ√©s.Cette d√©cision est avant tout destin√©e √† r√©duire les co√ªts apr√®s le rachat d'Activision Blizzard , l'√©diteur de titres √† succ√®s tels que Call of Duty et Candy Crush. En janvier, le groupe s'√©tait d√©j√† s√©par√© de 1.900 de ses salari√©s.¬´ Dans le cadre de la restructuration de nos √©quipes apr√®s l'acquisition [‚Ä¶], nous avons pris la d√©cision de supprimer environ 650 postes dans l'ensemble de Microsoft Gaming - principalement des fonctions administratives - afin d'organiser nos activit√©s en vue d'une r√©ussite √† long terme ¬ª, justifie encore Phil Spencer dans cette lettre. Avant d'affirmer que cette nouvelle coupe des effectifs et cette r√©organisation permettront d'assurer une ¬´ croissance future durable ¬ª. Toujours selon Phil Spencer, aucun jeu ou nouveau produit ne sera annul√©, et aucun studio ne sera ferm√©.
Publicit√©
Des annonces qui ont, sans surprise, provoqu√© la col√®re des syndicats et notamment le puissant Communication Workers of America (CWA), qui revendique plus de 6.000 membres dans les secteurs peu syndiqu√©s des technologies et des jeux vid√©o.Please read the following statement from @CWAUnion regarding Microsoft's decision to lay off 650 video game workers: https://t.co/VCt0JWfu07 ¬´ Nous aurions pu esp√©rer qu'une entreprise comme Microsoft, qui a r√©alis√© 88 milliards de dollars de b√©n√©fice net l'ann√©e derni√®re, puisse r√©ussir sur le long terme sans d√©truire les moyens de subsistance de 650 de nos coll√®gues ¬ª, explique le syndicat dans un communiqu√© o√π il affiche sa solidarit√© avec ¬´ tous ceux qui ont perdu leur emploi aujourd'hui ¬ª.¬´ Les licenciements impitoyables de ce type sont devenus trop fr√©quents ¬ª, a, de son c√¥t√©, r√©agi Samuel Cooper, un producteur du jeu World of Warcraft des studios Blizzard, et membre du syndicat CWA. Microsoft qui a finalis√© en octobre dernier l'acquisition d'Activision Blizzard pour 69 milliards de dollars, a aussi ferm√© en mai quatre studios de l'√©diteur Bethesda, qu'il avait rachet√© en 2020. ZOOM - Les g√©ants de la tech n'ont plus la cote aupr√®s des salari√©s Et d'autres groupes du secteur ont aussi annonc√© des suppressions de postes. A l'image de Sony ou de l'√©diteur am√©ricain de jeux vid√©o Electronic Arts . Des d√©cisions prises parfois sans √©tat d'√¢me. L'ancien pr√©sident de Sony Computer Entertainment Europe, Chris Deering, a ainsi sugg√©r√©, lors d'une interview sur le podcast ¬´ My Perfect Console ¬ª, que les personnes subitement au ch√¥mage aillent vivre dans un endroit pas cher pr√®s d'une plage ou ¬´ conduisent un Uber ¬ª jusqu'√† ce que le march√© de l'emploi s'am√©liore.

author: Michael DeRosa
title: Potential Sabres Star Target Is Off the Board - Yahoo Sports
text:
Read full article The Hockey News - Buffalo Sabres Potential Sabres Star Target Is Off the Board michael derosa Thu, Jul 25, 2024, 11:04 PM ¬∑ 1 min read Link Copied
It is no secret that the Buffalo Sabres could use one more top-six winger. While they have completely revamped their bottom six, they still lack the last star they need.
Because of this, one player who stood out as a potential trade target for the Sabres was Philadelphia Flyers forward Travis Konecny . The London, Ontario native was set to become an unrestricted free agent next summer, but now that will officially not be coming to fruition.
Konecny has signed an eight-year, $70 million contract extension with the Flyers. With this, there is no question that he will be staying with the Flyers for a very long time.
Travis Konecny
¬© Kyle Ross-USA TODAY Sports
Konecny would have been an excellent addition to the Sabres' lineup if acquired. The 27-year-old has become a star for Philadelphia, and last season was no different. In 76 games with the Metropolitan Division club, he had 33 goals and 68 points - both new career highs.
While the chances of Konecny getting dealt during next season are non-existent after this deal, the Sabres still have other potential top-six options which they could target. Some include Nikolaj Ehlers ( Winnipeg Jets ), Trevor Zegras ( Anaheim Ducks ), and Frank Vatrano (Ducks).

title: Les temp√©ratures mondiales se maintiennent toujours au-dessus d'1,5¬∞C de r√©chauffement
text:
Les temp√©ratures mondiales se maintiennent toujours au-dessus d'1,5¬∞C de r√©chauffement
AFPAgence
- Publi√© le 08-05-2025 √† 04h27
- √† Paris, France
Les temp√©ratures mondiales sont rest√©es √† des niveaux historiquement √©lev√©s en avril, poursuivant une s√©rie de pr√®s de deux ans de chaleur in√©dite sur la plan√®te qui agite le milieu scientifique sur la vitesse du r√©chauffement climatique.
Au niveau mondial, avril 2025 se classe deuxi√®me plus chaud derri√®re avril 2024, selon l'observatoire europ√©en Copernicus, qui se fonde sur des milliards de mesures issues de satellites, stations m√©t√©o et autres outils.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Missiles from Yemen Spark New Tensions in Israel and Lebanon | Politics
text: Missiles from Yemen Spark New Tensions in Israel and Lebanon Israel intercepted a missile from Yemen, intensifying ongoing conflicts. Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed strong military action against Hezbollah amidst airstrikes in Beirut and cross-border attacks. The violence has displaced thousands and killed hundreds, raising fears of another prolonged conflict similar to the 2006 war. Israel's military intercepted a missile from Yemen, triggering air raid sirens across central Israel, including Tel Aviv. Previously, on October 7, another missile from Yemen had struck central Israel. Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed robust military action against Hezbollah, further denting ceasefire hopes proposed by US and European officials. Israeli strikes in Beirut killed a senior Hezbollah commander as the militant group launched rockets into Israel. The conflict has displaced thousands near the Israel-Lebanon border. Netanyahu, attending the U.N. General Assembly in New York, faced international pressure to halt the violence temporarily. Amid intensified strikes targeting Hezbollah, hundreds have died in Lebanon. Despite diplomatic efforts, Israel continues its military operations, displacing 100,000 Lebanese and preparing for a possible ground invasion. The escalation revives fears of a repeat of the 2006 war. (With inputs from agencies.)

author: Dan Alexander
title: Floods in NJ: Rushing water sweeps man off path, records broken
text: Floods in NJ: Rushing water sweeps man off path, records broken üíßSome New Jersey rivers will not recede until Sunday üíß Long-standing flood-level records were broken üíßNJ 101.5 Fast Traffic is tracking roads still closed Several flood levels were broken Friday as Flood Warnings remain in effect along several New Jersey rivers after Wednesday‚Äôs heavy rain. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell in northern counties where rivers and streams are already full from two previous rounds of rain. Swept away by rushing water Rising water in the Raritan River swept a man off a walking path and into the water Thursday morning according to the Somerville Rescue Squad. The man became trapped in several bamboo trees and was clinging to a log before the Somerville Rescue Squad arrived. A water rescue team reached the man and got him out using a flotation device. He was taken to a hospital for treatment of hypothermia. Flood Warnings still in effect Flood Warnings remain in effect as the Millstone River in Somerset County, the Rockaway River in Morris County and the Passaic River in Essex, Morris & Passaic counties. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the same situation as our last super-soaker rain storm. All that water has to go someplace. The water flowing downstream is causing waters to approach and exceed flood stage,‚Äù according to New Jersey 101.5 Chief Meteorologist Dan Zarrow. The Passaic River in Little Falls is expected to crest just over flood stage at 7.4 Friday night and then start to recede, according to Zarrow. ‚ÄúThe Millstone River at Blackwells River crested above its flood state at a record 10 feet Friday morning and had already started to recede. ‚Äú It broke the record of 9.3 feet set in March 2011, according to National Weather Service records. No relief until Sunday The Rockaway River at Boonton Below Reservoir also broke a long-standing record cresting at 6 feet on Vail Road in Montville Friday morning. The previous flood level was 5.7 feet set in April 1986. A Flood Warning remains posted until Sunday for the Passaic River above Singac which went above flood stage at 9.1 feet Friday morning. It will remain there until Sunday morning. The water level will likely match a flood level of 9.3 feet set in April 2022. The Passaic River at Pine Brook, which affects Essex, Passaic and Morris counties, is under a flood warning until further notice. The river rose to 19.7 feet and will not stop rising until it hits 19.9 feet Friday night. The river‚Äôs high mark is 19.8 feet set in January 1996. New Jersey 101.5 Fast Traffic is tracking the remaining road closures all weekend long. "The good news is that New Jersey's weather has dried out completely, and there are no big storms on the horizon for about a week. That will allow rivers and floodwaters to continue receding," Zarrow said. [Report a correction](mailto:trenton.dme@townsquaremedia.com?subject=Feedback or correction) üëà | üëâ [Contact our newsroom](https://nj1015.com/contact-nj-1015-newsroom/) Dan Zarrow's Top 10 Weather and Climate Stories of 2023 Gallery Credit: [Dan Zarrow](https://nj1015.com/author/danzarrow) Restaurants that closed in New Jersey During 2023 [Dan.Alexander@townsquaremedia.com](mailto:Dan.Alexander@townsquaremedia.com">Dan.Alexander@townsquaremedia.com). Gallery Credit: Dan Alexander Missed your exit? A message for those who go in reverse Gallery Credit: [Mike Brant](https://nj1015.com/author/mikebrant/)

author: Leonardo Nunes
title: Primeira trufa cultivada em clima tropical √© descoberta em Morungaba, SP! Entenda TUDO:
text: Uma descoberta in√©dita no mundo da truficultura est√° moldando o futuro do cultivo de trufas no Brasil. Em setembro de 2024, uma trufa foi encontrada em Morungaba, no interior de S√£o Paulo , marcando a primeira vez que essa iguaria foi cultivada em um clima tropical. Este feito incr√≠vel foi liderado pelo engenheiro Fernando Heer, do Projeto Jaguarub√°, e promete revolucionar o potencial brasileiro de produ√ß√£o de trufas. O crescente interesse pela produ√ß√£o de trufas no Brasil teve in√≠cio com o ambicioso Projeto Jaguarub√°, iniciado em 2015. Inicialmente, o projeto concentrou-se na planta√ß√£o de florestas de madeira nobre, mas em 2020, passou a focar tamb√©m no cultivo de trufas, sob a consultoria de especialistas como o bi√≥logo Marcelo Sulzbacher e o engenheiro agr√¥nomo Marcio Frantz. Juntos, eles transformaram antigas pastagens de gado em um viveiro de trufas promissor. Como a Trufa Foi Cultivada nos Tr√≥picos? O processo que levou ao cultivo das trufas em climas mais quentes foi engenhoso. O uso de nogueiras-pec√£ foi essencial, pois essas √°rvores, uma vez inoculadas com esporos de trufa, criam o ambiente perfeito para o desenvolvimento do fungo. Em setembro de 2024, o cultivo brasileiro foi coroado com sucesso quando a equipe encontrou uma pequena trufa imatura, sinalizando um avan√ßo significativo para a agricultura nacional. Ao contr√°rio das expectativas anteriores, a trufa foi encontrada em menos de dois anos, muito mais r√°pido do que o cronograma padr√£o europeu, que pode levar de seis a oito anos. Isso aconteceu gra√ßas ao intemperismo do solo brasileiro, que acelerou o desenvolvimento da trufa conhecida como Sapucay, uma variante do g√™nero Tuber. O Que S√£o as Trufas e Por Que S√£o Valiosas? As trufas s√£o um tipo de fungo subterr√¢neo da fam√≠lia Tuber, que se desenvolve em simbiose com ra√≠zes de √°rvores como carvalhos e nogueiras-pec√£. Conhecidas por seu aroma e sabor intensos, esses cogumelos t√™m um grande valor no mercado gastron√¥mico, especialmente as variedades como a trufa branca italiana e a trufa negra francesa. Na culin√°ria, as trufas s√£o um ingrediente luxuoso. Embora cres√ßam naturalmente em regi√µes de clima frio, seu cultivo em regi√µes tropicais como o Sudeste do Brasil representa uma nova fronteira. Assim, a adapta√ß√£o do cultivo para √°reas semi-tropicais na Serra Ga√∫cha j√° se mostrava vi√°vel antes da descoberta em Morungaba. Qual √© o Futuro da Truficultura no Brasil? O impacto da trufa tropical brasileira √© promissor, sugerindo um potencial de exporta√ß√£o n√£o s√≥ do produto, mas tamb√©m da tecnologia de cultivo para outras regi√µes do mundo. Com um mercado que valoriza iguarias como essas, o Brasil pode se tornar um novo p√≥lo de refer√™ncia na truficultura, oferecendo uma alternativa vi√°vel para √°reas impactadas pelas mudan√ßas clim√°ticas. A valoriza√ß√£o das trufas no mercado internacional tamb√©m promete trazer benef√≠cios econ√¥micos para os produtores locais. A Sapucay, descoberta em v√°rias propriedades no Brasil, tem um valor de mercado elevado, comparado √†s variedades mais prestigiadas da Europa, tornando o cultivo e a comercializa√ß√£o ainda mais atraentes. Em conclus√£o, a descoberta em Morungaba √© mais do que um marco para a agricultura tropical; √© uma demonstra√ß√£o de como a inova√ß√£o pode transformar o cen√°rio agr√≠cola de um pa√≠s, abrindo novas oportunidades de crescimento econ√¥mico e sustent√°vel. Siga a gente no Google Not√≠cias

author: Elisabeth Braw
title: Do a good deed for your country ‚Äî stay home ‚Äì POLITICO
text: Elisabeth Braw is a senior fellow at the Atlantic Council, the author of the award-winning ‚ÄúGoodbye Globalization‚Äù and a regular columnist for POLITICO. EU diplomat Johan Floderus is now back home in Sweden, and so is Iranian-Swedish dual national Saeed Azizi. Professional basketball player Brittney Griner is safely back in America, while consultant Michael Spavor and diplomat Michael Kovrig are back in Canada. You may be familiar with these names ‚Äî individuals who were exchanged for a person their state captors wanted released, making headlines across the world over.
